channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flyposted blue A4 advertisement and expired ad for the annual Bromley Park User Satisfaction survey on the chestnut paling fence in Beckenham Green, High St frontage, about 3m from the footway, near St George's Church., 2nd November
item.description:
Flyposted blue A4 advertisement and expired ad for the annual Bromley Park User Satisfaction survey on the chestnut paling fence in Beckenham Green, High St frontage, about 3m from the footway, near St George's Church. Conservation Area

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spray tags on the brick pillars of the Vicar's Oak Gate of Crystal Palace Park at the jct of Crystal Palace Parade and Anerley Hill., 2nd November
item.description:
Spray tags on the brick pillars of the Vicar's Oak Gate of Crystal Palace Park at the jct of Crystal Palace Parade and Anerley Hill. Conservation Area. Regarding the annoying pop up box on Bromley Fix My Street, I am sadly fully aware that Bromley Council has disposed of CPP to an unelected, unaccountable, self-perpetuating 11 person Quango, the CPP Trust. However Bromley Council provides grafitti removal free to victims where it is visible from the street. I am so requesting this removal. Please reprogram Bromley FMS to allow grafitti removal to be reported without thus annoying pop up box and barrier to proceeding further.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request a litter bin to be installed, 2nd November
item.description:
There is an ongoing issue with littering around the junction of blithdale road and Brodrick grove. The installation of a litter bin would help alleviate this problem. It would also stop foxes from making the problem worse by dragging the food cartons around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merrow Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Black Bin Liners still on the pavement, 2nd November
item.description:
Hello, ILast week I reported that once again fly tippers have dumped full bin liners on the pavement outside our home. I received an email from Southwark saying the issue had been resolved. This is not correct. The three full large bin liners are still there. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Alleyn Road, Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 piles of leaves, 2nd November
item.description:
I have swept leaves into 2 piles as we do not get our kerbs cleaned as when cars go to work other cars park there during the day to go to work in nearby shops.outside 219 and 217 Croydon Road Beckenham

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 177, Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars that shouldn’t be parked in these bays are parking, 2nd November
item.description:
I am a permit holder and sometimes when i come home from work i cant find a place to put my car as they are all full and the disabled bays are empty but i cant use them as iam not a bluebadge holder cars that i have never seen before park here
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunnock Mews, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MASSIVE fly tip 96 Belgrave Road, 2nd November
item.description:
PLEASE can the council do something?? This is a constant issue. Either the rubbish is not being picked up OR people are dumping out of hours... This has gone on for so long and residents feel defeated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, London

item.title: No bollard to stop cars driving through, 2nd November
item.description:
Ever since they re-painted the road markings and removed the bollard at the end of glenarm road I’ve seen multiple cars drive through the small space at speed. A new bollard or obstruction needs to be put in to prevent this as it’s dangerous
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping still, 2nd November
item.description:
I reported this already and it was marked as resolved. Nothing has been resolved, noone has contacted me, all of the rubbish and old furniture and waste is still piled up outside my house. There are 2 sinks, 2 radiators, 1 hob, 1 bin, kitchen sideboards, and lots of random rubbish. People are now adding household waste to the pile. The neighbourhood is full of small children who play on this street and it's unsafe, unsanitary and unsightly. Please remove the items and please don't mark this as fixed without taking action, like last time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Watts Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signpost bracket dangerously sticking out onto hard shoulder, hit by 2 Essex Fire appliances, 2nd November
item.description:
The signpost bracket, believed to be for a disused sign, sticks out into the hard shoulder. It has been hit by 2 separate Essex Fire Service appliances who were using the hard shoulder to respond to an emergency, both incurring damage to their wing mirrors. Exact location not known as crews did not stop, between J28 and J27.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M25, Navestock, Brentwood
Report on FixMyStreet
